body.p: Born on September 30, 1791 in Chester, Massachusetts. Moved to Pulaski County before 1818 to establish a Saltwork. He also operated a Wharf on the Cumberland River. Married Eliza E. Beaty on October 17, 1838. Produced the First raw silk in Kentucky in 1840. Established banking and insurance industries in the County. Served in Pulaski County as Justice of the Peace, Commissioner of Public Schools. Wait was a State Senator from 1848 - 1850 and 1857-1861. Superintendent for the construction of the Somerset, London, and Waitsborough turnpike road company formed in 1858. Died June 8, 1868 in Somerset, Kentucky.
